title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 21 ยง 1160.5 - Traffic movement and restriction
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 21 ยง 1160.5 - Traffic movement and restriction

State Regulations
(a) Passenger loading/unloading area. All
commercial vehicles, whether concessionaire or nonconcessionaire, shall load
and unload passengers and luggage at the areas designated by the airport
manager. (b) Commercial vehicle
staging area. Access to the commercial vehicle staging area ("staging area")
shall be limited to commercial ground transportation vehicles and other
vehicles authorized by the NFTA. Loading of passengers in this area is
permissible, but unloading of passengers is prohibited. (c) Parking area. Hotel/motel and
limousine/van operators may opt to pay a fee for the privilege of parking in
designated areas at the airport. Parking in these areas will be on a first
come-first serve basis. (d) Loading/unloading/staging/parking area requirements. While occupying designated
passenger loading, unloading, staging, and parking areas, all commercial
vehicle drivers shall turn off their vehicle engines as required by applicable
law. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes
R. & Regs. Tit. 21
ยง
1160.5

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
